intro: Sphaeralcea floribunda, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its globular shape, with numerous small, yellow flowers clustered at the top of the plant. The plant has hairy, succulent stems and leaves that are adapted to arid environments, allowing it to conserve water efficiently. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats. Sphaeralcea floribunda is a perennial species that produces seed pods containing small, round seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
